item.title: Managing one-to-many data with simple feature points
item.description: A common situation I have with my work is to have a single sample locations with multiple measurements (i.e.Â one-to-many). For example, soil cores taken at one location will have bulk density, carbon, etc. at the varying soil horizon depths. Another example would be sampling the deep location of a lake and taking water quality profiles with dissolved oxygen, temperature, etc. measured every meter. A typical solution for storing this would be a relational database with one table holding the site location information and another containing the multiple measurments (e.
